name: apidoc-generator-attributes
description: This specified additional options that can be specified when using Movio's scala generators

scala_model_props.description: Additional code generation information for case classes

fields.name: extends
fields.description: A list of Scala/Java classes that this model extends

scala_field_props.description: Additional code generation information for case class fields

fields.name: class
fields.description: The fully qualified Scala/Java class to use during implementation. Note that this class must have a json formatter defined in the generator code. Currenly only org.joda.time.LocalDate and org.joda.time.LocalDateTime are implemented. In the future this maybe a defined list of supported classes

fields.name: default
fields.description: Used as the default in a case class.

fields.name: example
fields.description: Used in documentation and as a default implementation when creating example implementation's of case classes

kafka_props.description: Information needed for generating Kafka wrappers, consumers and producers.

fields.name: data_type
fields.description: This is the name of the model that this kafka wrapper encapsulated. Model name is the same as defined in the models section

fields.name: topic
fields.description: [scala] This is a scala snippet that returns a string with the topic name for kafka. The generator creates a function on the kafka topic object `def topic(tenant: String) = <definition-goes-here>`

fields.name: message_generate_key
fields.description: [scala] This is a scala snippet that creates a string used as the message ID. The message ID is used as the kafka message ID. The generator creates a function on the case class `def generateKey(tenant: String) = <definition-goes-here>`
